notes:
MITRE is a US nonprofit that operates federally funded research and development centers (FFRDCs). In cybersecurity, MITRE created and maintains foundational identifier systems and frameworks: CVE (vulnerability IDs), CWE (weakness taxonomy), ATT&CK (adversary techniques), CAPEC (attack patterns), and ATLAS (AI threat landscape). When you see a CVE ID, CWE number, or ATT&CK technique — that's MITRE's work.

CISA contracts MITRE to operate the CVE Program. NVD (NIST) enriches CVE records with CVSS, CPE, and CWE data. CNAs (CVE Numbering Authorities) can assign CVE IDs under MITRE's program.

cve.description: The canonical vulnerability identifier system, operated by MITRE under contract with CISA.
cve.notes: CVE is the canonical identifier — other advisories cross-reference CVEs. NVD (NIST) enriches CVE records with CVSS scores, CPE entries, and CWE mappings, but NVD has processing backlogs. Quality of CVE descriptions varies by CNA — some provide detailed technical analysis, others minimal information. The cvelistV5 GitHub repo contains raw JSON records organized by year and bucket directories.
